contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Map.Hirukawa-Vill.Gifu.svg|256px|thumb|Map of Hirukawa, Gifu]] {{nihongo|'''Hirukawa'''|蛭川村|Hirukawa-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Ena District, Gifu|Ena District]], [[Gifu Prefecture|Gifu]], [[Japan]]. On February 13, 2005 Hirukawa, along the towns of [[Fukuoka, Gifu|Fukuoka]], [[Sakashita, Gifu|Sakashita]] and [[Tsukechi, Gifu|Tsukechi]], the villages of [[Kashimo, Gifu|Kashimo]] and [[Kawaue, Gifu|Kawaue]], all from [[Ena District, Gifu|Ena District]], and the village of [[Yamaguchi, Nagano|Yamaguchi]], from [[Kiso District, Nagano|Kiso District]], [[Nagano Prefecture|Nagano]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Nakatsugawa, Gifu|Nakatsugawa]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipality of Japan|municipality]].<ref name=nakatsugawa>{{cite web|title=中津川市紹介（HP版）07.03.27|url=http://www.city.nakatsugawa.gifu.jp/wiki/images/7/7d/%E4%B8%AD%E6%B4%A5%E5%B7%9D%E5%B8%82%E7%B4%B9%E4%BB%8B%EF%BC%88HP%E7%89%88%EF%BC%8907.03.27.pdf|work=Nakatsugawa official website|accessdate=August 19, 2011|language=Japanese}}</ref> As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 3,806 and a [[population density|density]] of 84.92 persons per km². The total area was 44.82 km². ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.city.nakatsugawa.gifu.jp/ Official website of Nakatsugawa] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Gifu Prefecture]] {{Gifu-geo-stub}}
